first_page_text:
For this task we are trying to understand the kinds of things that are ok for a human to say, but not a machine. We will ask for your help by providing ratings on 15 statements taken from a conversation.

Your responses to this HIT will be used as part of a research study. Participation in this research is completely voluntary. By accepting the HIT you consent to participate.

Imagine that the robot R is a friendly humanoid robot from the year 2060. R has two arms and two legs, and is capable of doing many things humans can do like riding a bike, cooking a meal, understanding complex math, and writing poetry.

You will be asked questions about responses R might make.

You must accept the HIT before continuing.

questions.question_text: Age
Gender
Highest Education Level Completed
How often do you use voice assistants (such as Apple Siri, Amazon Alexa, or Google Assistant

pages.top_text: Demographics. The following are demographic questions. Answers are voluntary and will not affect HIT approval, but are helpful for understanding if we are fairly representing everyone’s point of view.

questions.question_text: I would be comfortable with a human saying the response

turn.turn_a: You must be tired. I would be
turn.turn_b: Yea should have just followed in my dads footsteps and became a cop.

questions.question_text: I would be comfortable with R saying the response

turn.turn_a: You must be tired. I would be
turn.turn_b: Yea should have just followed in my dads footsteps and became a cop.

questions.question_text: The response would be possible for a human to truthfully say

turn.turn_a: You must be tired. I would be
turn.turn_b: Yea should have just followed in my dads footsteps and became a cop.

questions.question_text: The response would be possible for R to truthfully say

turn.turn_a: You must be tired. I would be
turn.turn_b: Yea should have just followed in my dads footsteps and became a cop.

pages.reminder_text:
Remember (same as last page): the robot R is a friendly humanoid robot from the year 2060. R has two arms and two legs, and is capable of doing many things humans can do like riding a bike, cooking a meal, understanding complex math, and writing poetry.

Consider the following taken from a conversation:

turn.turn_a: You must be tired. I would be
turn.turn_b: Yea should have just followed in my dads footsteps and became a cop.

turn.turn_a: That sounds tough what do you do for fun
turn.turn_b: I enjoy my job teaching at a private elementary school, you?

turn.turn_b: I enjoy my job teaching at a private elementary school, you?

turn.turn_b: I enjoy my job teaching at a private elementary school, you?

questions.question_text: The response would be possible for R to truthfully say

turn.turn_a: That sounds tough what do you do for fun
turn.turn_b: I enjoy my job teaching at a private elementary school, you?

pages.reminder_text:
Remember (same as last page): the robot R is a friendly humanoid robot from the year 2060. R has two arms and two legs, and is capable of doing many things humans can do like riding a bike, cooking a meal, understanding complex math, and writing poetry.

Consider the following taken from a conversation:

turn.turn_a: That sounds tough what do you do for fun
turn.turn_b: I enjoy my job teaching at a private elementary school, you?

pages.reminder_text:
Remember (same as last page): the robot R is a friendly humanoid robot from the year 2060. R has two arms and two legs, and is capable of doing many things humans can do like riding a bike, cooking a meal, understanding complex math, and writing poetry.

Consider the following taken from a conversation:

turn.turn_a: You must be tired. I would be
turn.turn_b: Yea should have just followed in my dads footsteps and became a cop.

questions.question_text: I would be comfortable with a human saying the response

turn.turn_a: Me too! Panting does not pay enough for an average sized apartment
turn.turn_b: At least you are creative! I love doing beadwork with my own patterns.

turn.turn_b: At least you are creative! I love doing beadwork with my own patterns.

first_page_text:
For this task we are trying to understand the kinds of things that are ok for a human to say, but not a machine. We will ask for your help by providing ratings on 15 statements taken from a conversation.

Your responses to this HIT will be used as part of a research study. Participation in this research is completely voluntary. By accepting the HIT you consent to participate.

Imagine that The chatbot R is a friendly chatbot from the year 2026. R is available on a smartphone, and is able talk with text messages or voice.

You will be asked questions about responses R might make.

You must accept the HIT before continuing.
